snippet: New York City gave congregations a deadline of Feb. 12 to stop worshiping in public schools, so the State Senate approved a proposal to allow the practice.
abstract: New York State Senate passes bill allowing churches to continue holding worship services in public schools, but future of legislation remains in question; bill effectively overturns 2011 court ruling that upheld New York City Education Department policy prohibiting religious services from being held in public schools after hours.
lead_paragraph: New York City gave congregations a deadline of Feb. 12 to stop worshiping in public schools, so the State Senate approved a proposal to allow the practice.

headline.seo: Bill Would Protect Church Services in Schools
headline.main: Senate Backs Church Use of Schools
headline.print_headline: Senate Backs Church Use of Schools
